  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Customer Lifecyle Management",
  "description": "First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria&#39;s largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head, Customer Lifecyle Management

Job Identification: 1619
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Duties &amp; Responsibilities


	Lead the design, mapping, and implementation of seamless customer journeys across all segments and touchpoints.
	Collaborate with stakeholders, including the CTO and product teams, to embed customer experience requirements into operational processes and digital solutions.
	Monitor and evaluate adherence to defined customer journeys, identifying gaps and opportunities for improvement.
	Oversee the performance and development of the Customer Lifecycle Management team, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
	Lead the creation of exceptional user experiences across all CX platforms, products, and customer touchpoints.
	Provide customer insights to support product development and ensure alignment with market needs.
	Champion the creation of intuitive and impactful user experiences across CX platforms, products, and service channels.
	Utilize data and customer behavior analytics to assess and enhance CX and UX across all delivery channels.
	Develop and manage a robust customer lifecycle framework that supports revenue acceleration and long-term customer value.
	Define customer value propositions and support their communication across relevant channels.


Requirements
Education:


	Minimum Education: First Degree in related discipline, Higher Degrees/Professional Certification


Experience:


	Minimum experience:10-years of relevant experience in Banking or other relevant Industry.

Head, Customer Lifecyle Management Job at First Bank of Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria's largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Customer Lifecyle Management
     

            
    



Job Identification: 1619
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Duties & Responsibilities


	Lead the design, mapping, and implementation of seamless customer journeys across all segments and touchpoints.
	Collaborate with stakeholders, including the CTO and product teams, to embed customer experience requirements into operational processes and digital solutions.
	Monitor and evaluate adherence to defined customer journeys, identifying gaps and opportunities for improvement.
	Oversee the performance and development of the Customer Lifecycle Management team, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
	Lead the creation of exceptional user experiences across all CX platforms, products, and customer touchpoints.
	Provide customer insights to support product development and ensure alignment with market needs.
	Champion the creation of intuitive and impactful user experiences across CX platforms, products, and service channels.
	Utilize data and customer behavior analytics to assess and enhance CX and UX across all delivery channels.
	Develop and manage a robust customer lifecycle framework that supports revenue acceleration and long-term customer value.
	Define customer value propositions and support their communication across relevant channels.


Requirements
Education:


	Minimum Education: First Degree in related discipline, Higher Degrees/Professional Certification


Experience:


	Minimum experience:10-years of relevant experience in Banking or other relevant Industry.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Service Quality Management Officer",
  "description": "First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria&#39;s largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Service Quality Management Officer (Head Office / North / South)

Job Identification: 1620
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Duties &amp; Responsibilities


	Execute service audits and spot checks across branches within assigned region (Head Office, North, or South) &mdash; measuring against enterprise CX standards.
	Track and validate Mystery Shopping outputs, escalate discrepancies, and support correction actions in collaboration with Retail Ops and Branch Managers.
	Collaborate with CX Measurement and Strategy leads to report weekly/monthly performance trends, regional gaps, and systemic service issues.
	Monitor compliance with branch experience standards &mdash; including ambience, queue handling, staff behavior, turnaround time, and digital self-service readiness.
	Serve as the regional liaison for Experience Management Committee (EMC) resolutions related to branch or channel service experience.
	Engage directly with branch leaders and regional heads to interpret CX performance data and agree on corrective measures.
	Support training initiatives or regional workshops focused on service quality improvement and CX culture embedding.
	Conduct root cause investigations for persistent customer complaints, service breakdowns, or experience failures within assigned locations.
	Validate consistency of experience delivery across various branches &mdash; ensuring brand promise is upheld nationwide.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Operations, Social Sciences, or related fields
	CX or Service Quality certifications (e.g., CCXP, COPC, Six Sigma Yellow/Green Belt) are an advantage


Experience:


	3&ndash;6 years of experience in service operations, quality assurance, branch management, or customer experience-related roles
	Prior experience in retail banking operations or field-based service quality roles is preferred.

Service Quality Management Officer Job at First Bank of Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria's largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Service Quality Management Officer (Head Office / North / South)
     

            
    



Job Identification: 1620
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Duties & Responsibilities


	Execute service audits and spot checks across branches within assigned region (Head Office, North, or South) — measuring against enterprise CX standards.
	Track and validate Mystery Shopping outputs, escalate discrepancies, and support correction actions in collaboration with Retail Ops and Branch Managers.
	Collaborate with CX Measurement and Strategy leads to report weekly/monthly performance trends, regional gaps, and systemic service issues.
	Monitor compliance with branch experience standards — including ambience, queue handling, staff behavior, turnaround time, and digital self-service readiness.
	Serve as the regional liaison for Experience Management Committee (EMC) resolutions related to branch or channel service experience.
	Engage directly with branch leaders and regional heads to interpret CX performance data and agree on corrective measures.
	Support training initiatives or regional workshops focused on service quality improvement and CX culture embedding.
	Conduct root cause investigations for persistent customer complaints, service breakdowns, or experience failures within assigned locations.
	Validate consistency of experience delivery across various branches — ensuring brand promise is upheld nationwide.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Operations, Social Sciences, or related fields
	CX or Service Quality certifications (e.g., CCXP, COPC, Six Sigma Yellow/Green Belt) are an advantage


Experience:


	3–6 years of experience in service operations, quality assurance, branch management, or customer experience-related roles
	Prior experience in retail banking operations or field-based service quality roles is preferred.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Support Officer",
  "description": "ipNX is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today&rsquo;s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To Provide 1st-level support and ensure quick issue resolution in alignment with defined OLAs. Ensure smooth running of end-user workstations and coordinate the installation, enhancement and operational support of local area networks (LAN) and PBX.


Responsibilities


	Receiving and responding to calls.
	Identifying and researching problems.
	Providing assistance and instructions.
	Contacting appropriate vendors for service as needed.
	Monitor tickets on the service desk
	Process tickets first-in first-out based on priority
	Escalate tickets as necessary
	Liaise with HR to ensure new staff are properly setup and configured in all applicable systems.
	Liaise with Admin to ensure new staff are properly setup with the necessary work tools.
	Liaise with SCM to ensure purchase requests raised on behalf of staff are closed promptly
	Utilize and maintain the service desk system
	Evaluate, recommend and deploy end user productivity tools.
	Install and administer LAN including router, data switch, firewall and wireless access points.
	Maintain, monitor and ensure proper operation of Asterisk-based PBX installations.
	Enterprise endpoint security administration on desktops/laptops.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Communications or related field.
	1-2 years of directly related work experience in a technical helpdesk position supporting
	Windows 7, 8 &amp; 10, Microsoft Office tools or open source alternatives, and business applications in a business environment.
	Experience providing superior customer service and support.
	Experience working effectively in a team environment, communicating effectively, resolving issues efficiently, and contributing to the improvement of the infrastructure.
	Proven knowledge and understanding of TCP/IP, SMTP, SNMP, VPNs, and security methodologies.
	Thorough knowledge of voice and data communications techniques and technologies.
	Domain knowledge of Asterisk-based PBX.


Salary
N205,000 monthly.

IT Support Officer Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	To Provide 1st-level support and ensure quick issue resolution in alignment with defined OLAs. Ensure smooth running of end-user workstations and coordinate the installation, enhancement and operational support of local area networks (LAN) and PBX.


Responsibilities


	Receiving and responding to calls.
	Identifying and researching problems.
	Providing assistance and instructions.
	Contacting appropriate vendors for service as needed.
	Monitor tickets on the service desk
	Process tickets first-in first-out based on priority
	Escalate tickets as necessary
	Liaise with HR to ensure new staff are properly setup and configured in all applicable systems.
	Liaise with Admin to ensure new staff are properly setup with the necessary work tools.
	Liaise with SCM to ensure purchase requests raised on behalf of staff are closed promptly
	Utilize and maintain the service desk system
	Evaluate, recommend and deploy end user productivity tools.
	Install and administer LAN including router, data switch, firewall and wireless access points.
	Maintain, monitor and ensure proper operation of Asterisk-based PBX installations.
	Enterprise endpoint security administration on desktops/laptops.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Communications or related field.
	1-2 years of directly related work experience in a technical helpdesk position supporting
	Windows 7, 8 & 10, Microsoft Office tools or open source alternatives, and business applications in a business environment.
	Experience providing superior customer service and support.
	Experience working effectively in a team environment, communicating effectively, resolving issues efficiently, and contributing to the improvement of the infrastructure.
	Proven knowledge and understanding of TCP/IP, SMTP, SNMP, VPNs, and security methodologies.
	Thorough knowledge of voice and data communications techniques and technologies.
	Domain knowledge of Asterisk-based PBX.


Salary
N205,000 monthly.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the &quot;go to&quot; Quality Assurance &amp; Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Hybrid / Lagos
Reports To: Managing Director&nbsp;

Job Summary


	The Executive Assistant will provide high-level administrative and operational support to senior leadership, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations, effective communication, and efficient time management.
	The role requires discretion, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Support:


	Manage executives&rsquo; calendars, meetings, and appointments.
	Coordinate internal and external meetings, including preparation of agendas, meeting materials, and follow-ups.
	Handle confidential and sensitive information with professionalism and discretion.
	Act as a liaison between executives and internal/external stakeholders.


Communication &amp; Coordination:


	Manage emails, correspondence, and phone calls on behalf of executives.
	Draft, review, and edit emails, reports, presentations, and other documents.
	Track action items and ensure timely follow-up on decisions and deliverables.


Administrative &amp; Operational Support:


	Arrange travel plans, accommodations, and itineraries.
	Prepare expense reports and assist with budget tracking where required.
	Maintain organized records, files, and documentation.
	Support special projects and company initiatives as assigned.


Office &amp; Team Support:


	Assist with coordination of company events, meetings, and offsites.
	Work closely with HR, Finance, and other departments to support executive needs.
	Help streamline processes and improve administrative efficiency.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or equivalent experience.
	3 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar role.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace and collaboration tools.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work independently.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience supporting C-level executives.
	Familiarity with project management or task-tracking tools.
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.

Executive Assistant Job at Tezza Business Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the "go to" Quality Assurance & Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Hybrid / Lagos
Reports To: Managing Director 

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Executive Assistant will provide high-level administrative and operational support to senior leadership, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations, effective communication, and efficient time management.
	The role requires discretion, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Support:


	Manage executives’ calendars, meetings, and appointments.
	Coordinate internal and external meetings, including preparation of agendas, meeting materials, and follow-ups.
	Handle confidential and sensitive information with professionalism and discretion.
	Act as a liaison between executives and internal/external stakeholders.


Communication & Coordination:


	Manage emails, correspondence, and phone calls on behalf of executives.
	Draft, review, and edit emails, reports, presentations, and other documents.
	Track action items and ensure timely follow-up on decisions and deliverables.


Administrative & Operational Support:


	Arrange travel plans, accommodations, and itineraries.
	Prepare expense reports and assist with budget tracking where required.
	Maintain organized records, files, and documentation.
	Support special projects and company initiatives as assigned.


Office & Team Support:


	Assist with coordination of company events, meetings, and offsites.
	Work closely with HR, Finance, and other departments to support executive needs.
	Help streamline processes and improve administrative efficiency.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
	3 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar role.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace and collaboration tools.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work independently.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience supporting C-level executives.
	Familiarity with project management or task-tracking tools.
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

Personal Assistant Job at Tezza Business Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the "go to" Quality Assurance & Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lagos 
Reports To: Managing Director

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Personal Assistant will provide day-to-day administrative, personal, and organizational support to the managing director, helping to manage schedules, communications, and personal tasks efficiently.
	The ideal candidate is reliable, detail-oriented, discreet, and able to handle multiple responsibilities with professionalism.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative & Schedule Management:


	Manage the principal’s calendar, appointments, and reminders.
	Coordinate meetings, events, and personal engagements.
	Handle emails, messages, and phone calls as required.
	Organize documents, files, and records (digital and physical).


Personal & Errand Support:


	Assist with personal errands and day-to-day tasks.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, accommodations, and itineraries.
	Manage personal appointments such as medical, family, or social events.
	Support planning of personal and family events when needed.


Communication & Coordination:


	Act as a point of contact between the managing director and third parties.
	Draft messages, emails, and simple documents.
	Follow up on tasks, commitments, and action items.


Confidentiality & Trust:


	Handle sensitive personal and professional information with discretion.
	Maintain a high level of trust, professionalism, and integrity at all times.


Requirements & Qualifications:


	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Personal Assistant or similar role.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.
	High level of discretion and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in basic productivity tools (email, calendar, documents).
